result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Wayne Evenstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:59 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Thomas Wayne Evenstad, Defendant Thomas Wayne Evenstad in court. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Possession of THC. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possession of THC. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 4:14 PM. kma

Court orders: 
Ct 1 - Possession of THC
- Fine $500; payable through Clerk of Court
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Apply bond on file, payment plan approved.

Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Thomas Wayne Evenstad. INCLUDES 22CF485 and 22TR2250. Atty. Dolfi states that there will be a waiver of prelim today. DE sworn. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets PLEAS for later today. Adjourned: 12:10 PM. kma

records.addlTxt: Felony Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 7/27/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
from DE for emergency expedited motion to allow an exception to absolute sobriety for medications.  gll   to kp 7/28

$250 CASH BOND MUST BE POSTED NO LATER THAN 4:30 PM ON 7/26/2022. If bond is not posted by 7/26/22 at 4:30 PM, a warrant will be issued.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- Defendant must submit baseline test prior to release from custody.

1:15 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood and Intern Ali Casey in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Thomas Wayne Evenstad, Defendant Thomas Wayne Evenstad appeared by video, in custody. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  State requests bond. Atty. Harrelson makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Atty. Harrelson waives prelim time limits. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned:
Settlement conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
